means: 道德败坏，纪律松弛，士气消沉

sentence.Network_en: Top military leaders say there have been reports of demoralization in the ranks.
sentence.Network_cn: 最高军事指挥说有报告称士兵中出现了士气低落。

sentence.Network_en: Now, the sight of so many buildings and people completed Prissy's demoralization.
sentence.Network_cn: 此刻, 这么多的建筑物和人进一步把她迷惑住了.

sentence.Network_en: Either the Soviets sensed an imminent victory or they feared the approaching demoralization of their clients.
sentence.Network_cn: 要么是苏联人感到胜利已经呼之欲出,要么是他们担心他们的被保护人的士气行将崩溃.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... demophobic 群众恐惧症的 demoralization 道德败坏 demoralize 士气受挫.
考点词根~~ -... ... moralize v. 使道德化；教以道德；教化；训话 demoralization n. 伤风败俗；道德堕落；士气低落 ann,enn＝ 年.
所谓非道德化（demoralization），就是指个人原有的道德伦理体系彻底解体，它可以彻底改变一个人的信念和价值观，做出原本连想 …

list.abs: do not forgive their iniquity and let not their sin be blotted out before You , for they have demoralized the builders .尼4:5不要遮掩他们的罪孽、不要使他们的罪恶从你面前涂抹．因为他们在修造的人眼前惹动你的怒气。
Constant criticism is enough demoralize anybody ., 频繁的批评足以使任何人意志消沉.

list.exp: 丧失自信心、削弱勇气或志气的话语
list.abs: sàngqìhuà[demoralizing word] 丧失自信心、削弱勇气或志气的话语丧权辱国
the rejection can leave you demoralized .拒绝会让你失去斗志。

entry.tran: 使士气低落;使失去信心;使泄气
entry.def: If something demoralizes someone, it makes them lose so much confidence in what they are doing that they want to give up.

example.ex: Clearly, one of the objectives is to demoralize the enemy troops in any way they can.
example.tran: 很明显，目标之一就是要用一切可能的手段打击敌军的士气。

means.word_mean: 1. destroying the moral basis for a doctrine or policy
2. a state of disorder and confusion;

sentences.sentence: "his inconsistency resulted in the demoralization of his staff"

means.word_mean: 3. depression resulting from an undermining of your morale
